DataElement.preferredDefinition: The variable used to indicate that data are not available by having the site recording the value as "Not Done".

ValueDomain.preferredName: CDISC SDTM Not Done Terminology Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Terminology codelist used with Not Done within the Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium Study Data Tabulation Model._An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Indicate if the [VSTEST] meas
ReferenceDocuments.description: Indicate if the [VSTEST] measurement was not done

ReferenceDocuments.description: Terminology codelist used with Not Done within the Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium Study Data Tabulation Model.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Case Report Form
ReferenceDocuments.description: Indicate if the vital signs measurement was not done.

ReferenceDocuments.name: VSSTAT
ReferenceDocuments.description: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: A single "Not Done" can be collected once for all the tests on the same horizontal record using VSSTAT. The value of VSSTAT applies to all measurements on that record when mapped to SDTM. If needed, for each test "NOT DONE" may be collected using the CDASH variable [VSTESTCD]_VSSTAT.
